description: From Late Latin mandatorius (“of or belonging to a mandator”), from mandātor (“one who commands”); see mandate.

adjectives.description: mandatory (comparative more mandatory, superlative most mandatory)

entries.meaning: Obligatory; required or commanded by authority.
examples: Synonyms: compulsory, obligatory; see also Thesaurus:compulsory
Antonyms: optional, elective; see also Thesaurus:optional
Attendance at a school is usually mandatory for children.

entries.meaning: Of, being or relating to a mandate.
(disc golf) A sign or line that require the path of the disc to be above, below or to one side of it.
(dated, rare) A person, organisation or state who receives a mandate; a mandatary.
